intro: Mariscus pubens, commonly known as the hairy mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a reddish or bronze hue when young. Mariscus pubens produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, blooming in late spring to early summer.
